page.title: 14Local History and Population
page.content: The name{Blacon}derives from Old English for "at the black hill",which refers to Blacon Point,the promontory on the Dee Estuary. The original banks of the Dee are marked nowadays by a distinct line of trees.A second line of trees run past Thornleigh Park,marking later banks. CENSUS RETURNS. In 1851, 113 lived here. Only 7 were 50 or over. Most worked on farms. In 1981, 17988 lived here, 4547 were 50 or over More worked in service industries than production. {BLACON TODAY - AN ACROSTIC POEM B ig and bold Blacon stands, a L ittle higher than surrounding land.
